FuncDef:
The ds-lite load-balance hash-fields command configures hash elements used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing.
The undo ds-lite load-balance hash-fields ip l4 command restores the default hash elements used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing.
By default, the source and destination IP addresses are used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing.
CLIs: ds-lite load-balance hash-fields ip { l3 | l4 }
undo ds-lite load-balance hash-fields ip l4

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the source and destination IP addresses are used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing.
-

Indicates that the source and destination IP addresses and port numbers are used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing.
-

ExtraInfo: In a scenario of CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing, to change hash elements used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing, run the ds-lite load-balance hash-fields command. If the default hash elements are best, configure l3. Otherwise, configure l4 to implement best load balancing for network traffic.
